column4: Is there any way to refresh a floppy drive rather than remounting it?
refresh?
No, for some reason it caches the files, and refresh does nothing. Does anyone still use floppy disks?
rarely...
type 'sync ; sync'. When it returns, the buffers will be flushed
where\how?
in a terminal window
so "fd0 sync ; sync" ?
leave out the fd0
thx
sync flushes all the buffers on all disks
in edgy/feisty, click the upper right X and wait. If it doesn't respond, it will offer you to force-quit it after a few seconds.
I have dapper, but I have this "force quit" icon
click it, then click the window of the misbehaving program, then follow instructions
it's a notification from azureus; I cannot force close it.
hmm
try Alt-F2 xkill -- then click the notification.
failing that, open a terminal and run 'killall azureus'
none of the methods work.
okay, in that case, you have to step up the effort. Run 'ps ax | grep azu' and see if it shows any lines corresponding to the bad program.
you still with me?
